column4: I post the same question earlier today: I'm looking for an alternative to Unison File Synchronizer
also, gnome-schedule is a GUI for cron stuff
how does it react if there modification on both side ?
it syncs data between them and figures out which is older/newer, im not a guru on with rsync so about all I could help with, maybe man rsync for more info :)

you trying to back stuff up? sbackup is really nice too, once intalled you'll see it in system> administration Simple Backup Config, it has a gui, can schedule backups, has exclusions, and differential stuff too.
well, I'm trying to sync data for 3 differents computers. Each one may change over time...
yep, I'm using unison at this time.. but the user interface get me confused
there's an gui for unison too unison-gtk I believe it is
yeah I don't care for Unison's interface either
yep, I'm using this GUI, but it's not userfriendly at all ..
I try to make modification to it, but seriously, it's will take less time to rewrite it from scratch.
what about bacula? I think I spelled that correctly
just the fact that it's use ocaml ! wow what a confusing language compare to c and java
